document.title: Phonological Awareness and Listening Comprehension Among Chinese English-Immersion Students

author.institution: Faculty of Education, Queen's University, Canada
Faculty of Education, Queen's University, Canada
Faculty of Education, Queen's University, Canada

document.abstract: This study investigates the relationship between English listening comprehension and English and Chinese phonological awareness (PA), and the cross-linguistic transfer of PA in 48 Grade 2 and 47 Grade 4 Chinese English-immersion students. The results of the study indicate a correlation between English PA and English listening comprehension. English listening comprehension had a significant effect on English PA in both grades; this effect is evident after considering Chinese PA, but only in Grade 4. A similar pattern is found for the effect of English PA on English listening comprehension. Only weak evidence exists pertaining to a connection between cross-linguistic transfer from Chinese PA (L1) to English listening comprehension (L2).
